column4: Just installed mod_perl onto my ubuntu, had trouble with apache not finding libapreq.so (Apache::Request is installed) anyone know the correct way to tell apache where to find it
using dselect
I googled and found a solution but dont like it
no, I have a debian system aswell and diddn't have the problem
I will check there

I just updated ubuntu using dselect and now gnome dosn't seem to start and is stuck on the naked people loading screen - X is running and my mouse still works, where should I look to find out whats wrong?
create a new user and see if they can log in. it could be gnome-session trouble or something. (just guessing)

Made a new user and that got me further, I now have a GConf error about no databases to save my configuration - and another error about the gnome-panel attempting to change something that my system vendor does not allow
hmm. when did you last update before this?
first time it was an iso from a week or so ago
i'm pretty sure it's gconf or gnome-session daemon
I have a right click menu on the desktop but no menus, I'll try your suggestions or as I have not configured anything yet use the latest iso, thanks
be warned that i don't know what i'm talking about
I just re-installed ubuntu using the latest RC iso and still get the same problem as I did when updating from an old iso - Gnome sits on the naked people screen and does not load
sorry, i honestly don't know what's wrong. you should file a bug. do you have some weird hardware in there?
no pretty standard p4 with GeForce 4, the old ubuntu worked fine
then it's surely a bug :(
thanks for your interest, I will have a go at fixing it by removing and reinstalling stuff
good luck! make sure the developers know about your problem
I just did the add another user thing you suggested and have managed to log in sucessfully so all is not lost, if I get more errors I will file a bug if I can figure out whats wrong
great! now you can try and clean up your home dir of all gnome settings (make backups!) and see if you can log in as yourself then...
doing that now thanks
